data.title: eclectic and fun
data.text: cozy is a good name for this place.  the walls are filled with collections: lunch boxes, pez dispensers, license plates--all sorts of things.  the food is filling and comforting.  i had the mild curry which is perfect for me--coconut milk, chicken, potatoes, and peas that is just spicy enough without being at all fiery.  my friend had the pad see ewe with beef--the veggie here is broccoli.  a bit sweet and tasty.

data.title: Great tai with kitch
data.text: When you look in the window, your not sure if it's a restaurant or a collectables shop. It's easy to be overwhelmed by the awesome collection of lunch boxes and pez dispencers from the past 50 years.  But then you get down to the food - pad thai, spring rolls, pad se yu  all really great.  The waitstaff was pleasant and fast.

data.title: Quick and Good Lunch
data.text: I've been to this cute place for a few solo lunches.  The food arrives quickly and I've enjoyed everything I've ordered.  I'll be back many times in the future to try some of the items mentioned in other reviews.

data.title: Good Food and Gluten free too
data.text: The food is always tasty here. My husband really likes the curries. The Pad SeeEwe was rather bland but everything else was very good.

data.title: Poor Service
data.text: The food is good but the hostess is nasty and rude.  On two occasions she made my party move after we were seated because she wanted someone elst to sit at the table.

data.title: Great Thai Food
data.text: Cozy Noodles is my personal gold standard for Thai food.  The portions are large, they have brown rice, everything is fresh and the ambience is great!

data.title: Great spot for a meal to catch up with friends
data.text:
Tucked away on Davis away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Evanston Cozy is a quaint little eatery for the noodle and rice lover. With a large menu or options, you can find something for anyone craving an Asian inspired dish. The Evanston Curry Noodles and Crispy Pad See Ewe are delicious. All of their appetizers are delicious and easy to share with the table. 

Cozy is also BYOB so be sure to pack a bottle or stop at the store across the street to pick out from their crazy variety of beers and ciders to bring in.

data.title: One of the two best Thai restaurants in Evanston.
data.text:
Don't let the campy decor fool you. The food here is excellent. While some dishes tend in the direction of fusion cuisine, most of it is quite authentic, if a little oddly named, e.g., "Crazy Noodles." But for all I know, that's a direct translation.

This is a cozy place, like an eccentric family home. It's one of my favorite places either on those raw, windy, bone-chilling days, or in the sultry days of summer. There's something perfect for either on the menu.

Service is outstanding.

data.title: IMO, #2 pad thai in Evanston
data.text: My roommate and I have conducted a pretty comprehensive study of the pad thai options in Evanston and have determined that behind Siam Splendour this is the #2 place for Pad Thai in Evanston. It's very good, has a lot of menu options, and the space is very very interesting and cute. Pretty cozy. BYOB. Recommend.

data.title: Wonderful.
data.text: Best red curry dish I've ever had -- comes in a big bowl with jasmine rice on the side. Hot, but not too hot. So good I had it 2 days in a row! My son is addicted to the Evanston noodles, spicy soft noodles with a few crunchy ones atop -- also very good. Very, very crowded on a Sat night, though. The owner apologized for the long wait, brought us free spring rolls in apology -- that's good service. Old tin toys, Pez dispensers, lunch boxes line the walls-- a fun place for boomers. And it's BYOB.

data.title: Below Average
data.text: Food is just okay, service is not that great either. The whole place needs to be cleaned, there are all kinds of toys and lunch boxes that have been sitting on the shelfs for a long time that have dust on them. If you do go its BYO so remember that.

data.title: Great Asian Noodle Soup!
data.text: Oh my, This is my favorite place to eat on a cold day.  I love their different types of Asian noodle soup.  Have them add a little more spice....if you like spicy food

data.title: Go to Joy Yee's instead!
data.text:
We usually enjoy Thai food and this place was very near our hotel.  Very kitchsy place with walls covered with license plates.  Prices were very low.  We had the Bamee Noodles with BBQ pork which we did not enjoy and the Pad Khee Mao which was tasty.

We had been to Joy Yee's Noodle Kitchen the previous day, which was MUCH tastier - I guess Cozy Noodles suffered in comparison...

data.title: Yum and fun!
data.text: Fun decor with license plates and other collectibles, not to mention yummy noodles.  Great place for an relaxed, low key dinner.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text:
We stopped in- not even knowing of the restaurant and were impressed immediately.  The charming knick knacks make for a fun environment while the staff was courteous.  

Talk about value- prices were good but the food was amazing!! My girlfriend is very...refined when it comes to flavors.  We both were impressed.

data.title: Its good for a change.
data.text: This the second time i visited this place and every time the food is just yummy. For a change of taste and its near my place i would love to visit it again and again. The decor at the restaurant is so different and my friends from Indianapolis also just loved the food and the restaurant. The staffs are friendly. I would love to visit it again.

data.title: Went Kind of Downhill
data.text:
Still love the funky casual decor.
Went to lunch recently & noticed a few changes:
the spring rolls appetizer came as tiny half portions of how they used to be, strangely small portion so mostly just the spring roll skin!
Cucumber salad still good.
The Pad See Eew was fine, ok.
 Asked the server about the Dumpling Noodle Soup dish which listed Chinese broccoli & bean sprouts whether there was a lot of these vegetables as I really wanted a lot of veggies that day - she said Yes & that it's very good.  Unfortunately, the 2 dumplings were soggy & there was just mostly egg noodles in the dish with only a tiny amount of shredded broccoli stems that were almost raw & almost no bean sprouts. Disappointing.

data.title: Great Thai restaurant
data.text: We've been here too many times to count. The food is very good, great prices and quick service. The staff is all business but we go for the food. Fun and kitschy  decor and definitely always a great place to go.

data.title: Inexpensive, neatly decorated with good food.
data.text: We were a party of 14.  All food was good.  Service was fast and efficient.  Most main courses were $7.95 with appetizers under $5.  Basically Thai and Chinese items.  Walls decorated with old license plates, very funny signs and hundreds and hundreds of Pez dispensers.  Good food and very easy on your wallet.  Two and one half blocks from Fountain Square (the center of town).  BOB

data.title: Quality Thai Food -- Creative Energetic Place
data.text:
Visually..... wall to wall you will be entertained for sure..... Great atmosphere.... and Fun.... I will leave it for you to find out for yourself.... I like to get seated in the second room  (not the one that you enter when you walk in the restaurant).... It is a bit less hussle bussle....

Food is always top notch... fresh... tasty....  I usually order the Cashew Chicken which packs a hot hot hot punch but I love it... I will keep coming back for more and more....   

Love this place....
